name: Esp-8266
tagline: Examples of use of MCU ESP8266 for integration in IoTFrog project
body:
### Welcome to IoTFrog project
The objecive of this project is study of develop a neuronal IoT network, based on ESP-8266, the main requisites are:
* Easy for end users
* Only need config same domain and password 
* Remote managment using web statdard browsed (HTML5, CSS3, javascrit)
* Nothing to intall on remote manager device (Smatphone, PC,...)
* Reply of devices as Html and json

You can see our web site on: [using www.IoTfrog.com](https://www.iotfrog.com/)

### Template of Modules requisites.
**Standar petition:**
All modules has a web server and they reply to this url 
* / -> Reply html form with menu and short descrition
* who -> (Who) reply de the name of device by default ESP-(ID)
* whe -> (Where) Reply where is it
* wha -> (What) Reply a list of orders and descrition of his reply
* sts -> (Status) Reply a list json of the status of sensor and actuattors.
* aba -> (Abaut) Short descrition and links for help and support
* hlp -> (help)  Reply a short guide
* log -> (Loggin) Reply login form (Need for to do changes)
* tre -> (Tree)  Reply description id for build a tree display (treeId, treeParentId, treeclass, and who)
* cfgw -> (Config wifi) send html form for config SIID, Password, IP,Mask, ...
* cfgo -> (Config other) send html form for config especific parameter of module, like email for send alarmas, time values, start stop schendule...
**Specifig module petition**
* mod_xxx ->(Module specific) this is the sintax prefig for petition for set   specific module values.

Examples:
mod_led?id=1&val=1 -> call handleLed method for set led 1 on, the reply say {led:1,val=1}
mod_led?id=1&val=0 -> call handleLed method for set led 1 off
mod_led?id=1 -> call handleLed method for get status of led 1, the reply can be {led:1,val=1}
mod_temp?id=1 -> call handleTemp method for get temperature of sensor 1, the reply can be {temp:1,val:27.05,unit:C}


set_relay?id=1&val=1 -> call handleRelay method for set relay 1 on


 
Note: All pettition can be asqued as html or json.
### Creating pages manually
If you prefer to not use the automatic generator, push a branch named `gh-pages` to your repository to create a page manually. In addition to supporting regular HTML content, GitHub Pages support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator. Jekyll makes it easy to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features.

### Authors and Contributors
You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor’s GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out our [documentation](https://help.github.com/pages) or [contact support](https://github.com/contact) and we’ll help you sort it out.
